column4: plz help :S    i use the youtube-lens for unity, but when i click a video, it opens vlc and vlc says that it can't open the video
Figures if it isn't in the Official repository we can't do much helpwise.
i think it's a problem of vlc, and this is in the official repos
I'm referring to youtube-lenses.
:P
true, but i tried to open a youtube-video with vlc without the lens and it displays the same error
Seeing as Youtube-Lenses has to be fetched from a unofficial PPA.
Any form of VLC plugin installed to view the videos?
nope, i just installed vlc... do i have to install a plugin?
I can't say but if it's loading VLC as it's default player. Figures, it'll need a VLC plugin for Firefox.
I don't use youtube-lenses I can't comment much on that aspect. But if you'd like to try you can install the Mozilla plugin for VLC in the Software Center.
i enter the url in the "open network-stream..." dialogue of vlc, then it says that it can't determine the format of the video...
so it doesn't open when i just click on a youtube-video in firefo
x
I don't think the youtube URL is meant for the "Open Network Stream".
oh, ok... i just did it because a tutorial on a website said this is the way to open youtube-vids with vlc
Not a fan of tutorials they can be poorly written or misleading. At times they can be useful but if you're learning programming or something else best to stick too a book.
hm... ok, one last question: do you know the path of the lua-directory of vlc in ubuntu?
Though it does show a URL of youtube in Open Network Stream doesn't seem like anything is playing.
Not that I know of.
I assume this is it: /usr/share/vlc/lua
But than again this could be it too: /etc/vlc/lua
